extracted_text:
CIPLA Ltd had two notable corporate developments on August 27, 2025: a product recall in the U.S. and the completion of a strategic acquisition .

Cipla is recalling over 20,000 packs of its Ibuterol Sulfate Inhalation Aerosol in the U.S., as confirmed by a U.S. Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) report.

The recall was initiated on July 24 due to "Failed Stability Specifications" related to "Out-of-specification results" found during particle size distribution analysis at the 12-month time point.

Cipla announced it completed its acquisition of a 20% stake in Bengaluru-based iCaltech Innovations Private Limited.

The partnership is intended to build integrated healthcare solutions by combining Cipla's pharmaceutical expertise with iCaltech's medical device technologies, with a focus on respiratory care and diagnostics.

Cipla first announced its plan to invest about â‚¹5 crore for the stake on July 21, 2025.
